#summary Functions for loading & managing textures.

=== !CreateTexture(string name, string group, real type, real width, real height, real num_mips, real pixel_format, real usage) ===
----
Create a manual texture with specified width, height and depth (not loaded from a file). 
====Parameters====
   * _name_ - The unique name to give the texture.
   * _group_ - The resource group to assign the texture.
   * _type_ - The type of texture to load/create, defaults to normal 2D textures. Can be:
      * global.TEX_TYPE_1D
      * global.TEX_TYPE_2D
      * global.TEX_TYPE_3D
      * global.TEX_TYPE_CUBE_MAP
   * _width_, _height_, _depth_ - The dimensions of the texture
   * _num_mips_ - The number of pre-filtered mipmaps to generate.
   * _pixel_format_ - The internal format you wish to request; the manager reserves the right to create a different format if the one you select is not available in this context. Can be:
     * global.PF_L8
     * global.PF_L16
     * global.PF_A8
     * global.PF_A4L4
     * global.PF_BYTE_LA
     * global.PF_R5G6B5
     * global.PF_B5G6R5
     * global.PF_A4R4G4B4
     * global.PF_A1R5G5B5
     * global.PF_R8G8B8
     * global.PF_B8G8R8
     * global.PF_A8R8G8B8
     * global.PF_A8B8G8R8
     * global.PF_B8G8R8A8
     * global.PF_A2R10G10B10
     * global.PF_A2B10G10R10
     * global.PF_DXT1
     * global.PF_DXT2
     * global.PF_DXT3
     * global.PF_DXT4
     * global.PF_DXT5
     * global.PF_FLOAT16_RGB
     * global.PF_FLOAT16_RGBA
     * global.PF_FLOAT32_RGB
     * global.PF_FLOAT32_RGBA
     * global.PF_X8R8G8B8
     * global.PF_X8B8G8R8
     * global.PF_R8G8B8A8
     * global.PF_DEPTH
     * global.PF_SHORT_RGBA
     * global.PF_R3G3B2
     * global.PF_FLOAT16_R
     * global.PF_FLOAT32_R
     * global.PF_SHORT_GR
     * global.PF_FLOAT16_GR
     * global.PF_FLOAT32_GR
     * global.PF_SHORT_RGB
   * _real usage_ - The kind of usage this texture is intended for. Can be a combination of:
      * global.TU_STATIC
      * global.TU_DYNAMIC
      * global.TU_WRITE_ONLY
      * global.TU_AUTOMIPMAP
      * global.TU_RENDERTARGET
      * global.TU_DEFAULT
      You are strongly advised to use global.TU_STATIC + global.TU_WRITE_ONLY wherever possible, if you need to update regularly, consider  global.TU_DYNAMIC + global.TU_WRITE_ONLY.
  *
